text: The Venerable Thomas Goodwin, D.D. was an Anglican priest in England during the 17th Century."The history and gazetteer of the county of Derby" Glover, S: Derby; H.Mozley; 1831 Ryder was born at Hinton, Hampshire and educated at Magdalen College, Oxford.Alumni Oxonienses 1500-1714, Gilpin-Greenhaugh He held living at Slimbridge, Wood Eaton, Droxford and Launton. He was appointed Warden of the Hospital of St John Baptist without the Barrs, Lichfield and Archdeacon of Derby in 1704, holding both positions until his death on 10 June 1719. Helme died in 1628. == Notes == Category:Alumni of Magdalen College, Oxford Category:Archdeacons of Derby Category:18th-century English Anglican priests Category:1719 deaths Category:People from Hampshire
title: Thomas Goodwin (Archdeacon of Derby)
